sn48.51:1: Thus have I heard. On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling among the Kosalans at Sala, a brahmin village. There the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:
sn48.51:2: "And what, bhikkhus, are the states conducive to enlightenment? The faculty of faith, bhikkhus, is a state conducive to enlightenment; it leads to enlightenment. The faculty of energy is a state conducive to enlightenment; it leads to enlightenment. The faculty of mindfulness is a state conducive to enlightenment; it leads to enlightenment. The faculty of concentration is a state conducive to enlightenment; it leads to enlightenment. The faculty of wisdom is a state conducive to enlightenment; it leads to enlightenment.sn.v.8
